name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Missouri research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Missouri ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Missouri ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for Missouri research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Missouri research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Missouri Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Missouri research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Missouri Overview—1:44

  3. Follow this research study for Missouri ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Missouri Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Missouri research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Missouri Resources
    ☆ AC—Missouri State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Missouri Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Missouri Record Finder

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Follow this case study for Missouri research.

      ☆ LDS—Finding a family's address in St Louis


    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Missouri in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Missouri

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—Missouri African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Missouri.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Missouri in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Missouri
Additional Records

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Missouri archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Missouri archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Missouri archives and libraries in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Missouri Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Missouri State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Missouri.
  3. Explore Missouri Dept. of Archives collection.
  4. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Missouri genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  5. Search for ☆free online books on Missouri research on the FamilySearch site.
  6. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Missouri ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Missouri city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Missouri Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Missouri city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Missouri city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Missouri ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Missouri city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

name: Vital and Census Records
section_name: Learn about Missouri vital and census records.

hidden.summary:

hidden.exercises:

text:

    ☆ AC—Wiki: Missouri Vital Records

  2. Explore links for vital records on the Missouri Public Health site.
  3. Search for online Missouri ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  4. Explore Missouri birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Missouri vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site and the Genealogy Branches site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Missouri research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  3. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Missouri County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Missouri.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Missouri Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Missouri research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Missouri Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Missouri Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Explore the Missouri Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. Midwest Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Missouri.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Missouri research.
  2. Explore the Missouri research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with Missouri research.
  4. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Missouri research.
  5. Explore Missouri research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Missouri in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Missouri Societies

  2. Explore the Missouri Historical Society Library and Research Center site.
  3. Explore the Missouri State Genealogical Association site.
  4. Explore Missouri genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Missouri.
Regional/Local Societies
